alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 25 at 6:07PM MST until June 25 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... East central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 606 PM MST, blowing dust from storms between Tacna and Gila Bend. Storms are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 43 and 102. Locations impacted include... Dateland, Sentinel, Paloma, Tyson, Mohawk and Tacna. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
